tweets.text: The @EnvAgency  Target for inspecting sewage works in Thames region in 2017 was on average once every EIGHT YEARS. Target 33 achieved 17. Still the leadership cut the monitoring staff. Wondering where it all went wrong? @EmmaHowardBoyd

A member of our team was out surveying for gully blocks on Ilkley Moor, for a Natural Flood Management project, when she saw this glorious gathering of golden plovers ü§©
This #NFM project is being carried out with @EnvAgencyNW & @bradfordmdc https://t.co/Wd3dEuzfFO

Our operational teams have been out on the ground checking flood structures and making sure there are no blockages in rivers.

tweets.text: @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater They seem to be strong on words and shy on action. Let us all make sure that they deliver and that @EnvAgency support our communal actions to improve chalk streams rather than ignoring the issues. @IvelRev @Feargal_Sharkey @RiverChess @FriendsRib @OliverHealdUK
@CllrWarrenWhyte @EnvAgencyAnglia It also looks like @riverlevel_1592 needs calibration as it was flat out at the top of the graph on the 23rd.

I‚Äôm no hydrologist expert but even I was getting worried about water levels in Buckingham in the early afternoon of 23/12 but sadly @EnvAgencyAnglia ignored their own telemetry and didn‚Äôt call it a flood until circa 23:15 - which was far too late. https://t.co/mwx1ruiN90

You can tell that @DefraGovUK isn't serious about protecting our environment when you see that @EnvAgency funding for enforcement activity has halved in the past 10 years
https://t.co/OHEAQXcvZ4 
< no wonder industrial-scale #flytipping and pollution is rife.  Must #StopTheDrop
@MrSneakySnicker @worcscc @WyreForestDC @EnvAgencyMids Yes and gritted
Gosh that‚Äôs truly extraordinary that this did not get appealed! @eurocarparks1 https://t.co/hrhKT4YqjX

While river levels remain high in parts of the #Midlands we're not expecting much rain over the coming days

Snow is hitting some areas but we're not expecting any impacts so over the next couple of days we're taking down #flood barriers

If needed we can quickly put them back up https://t.co/InkuliemK6
Look forward to hearing better news in 2021 with @AffinityWater stepping up to the plate, apparently. https://t.co/sEOmJgc9qy

tweets.text:
New figures show #water company #pollution incidents rose from 1,863 in 2018 to 2,204 in 2019. 

Anglian, Southern, South West & Northumbrian Water all rated poor by @EnvAgency, putting the #25YearEnvironmentPlan & ecological recovery at risk.

https://t.co/WCsN6fStKk https://t.co/bHhT3FoqXm

Appearances can be deceptive. A healthy looking #RiverVer but no sign of any brown trout redds today, in fact no sign of a fish. The extreme dry and wet cycle of heavily abstracted #chalkstreams makes life precarious for large fish. https://t.co/uhSZpjUAAk

The Cam may have burst it's banks in recent days but the issue remains the same. The Cam is in Crisis @NaturalCambs @AnglianWater @Cambswater @EnvAgency @cambridgeIndy

tweets.text:
The state of the environment in England in now getting worse. A stark comment from the Environment Agency chair to Defra secretary George Eustice in a letter released to me under #FOI. EA chair Emma Howard Boyd blames 50% cuts to her enforcement budget. 

https://t.co/P0T4SoCn6O
Good article about our campaign https://t.co/goQ1qXJksP

‚úÖ And in other news ‚úÖ 

The @EnvAgencyMids have now taken down then flood barriers on The Wharfage in #Ironbridge

We are waiting for the road & footpaths to be gritted after the snowfall in order to reopen the road providing full access to all shops, restaurants and pubs. https://t.co/hsg0RKhG2R
